definitions.definition: an inclined part of a road or railway; a slope.
examples: fail-safe brakes for use on steep gradients
synonyms: grade "the gradient of Miller's Hill Road is less steep than it was fifty years ago"

examples: the path becomes very rough as the gradient increases

definitions.definition: the degree of steepness of a graph at any point.
an increase or decrease in the magnitude of a property (e.g., temperature, pressure, or concentration) observed in passing from one point or moment to another.
the rate of a gradient change.
the vector formed by the operator ∇ acting on a scalar function at a given point in a scalar field.
